citation.article-title: Ornithinibacter aureus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Intrasporangiaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Ornithinibacter [Or.ni.thi.ni.bac′ter. N.L. n. ornithinum ornithine; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Ornithinibacter ornithine(-containing) rod].
Cells are Gram-stain-positive, aerobic, non-motile, non-spore-forming, branching hyphal forms.
The cell-wall contains l-Orn as the major diagnostic diamino acid in the peptidoglycan.
The major polar lipid profile is phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and an unknown glycolipid.
Major cellular fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C18 : 1ω9c, iso-C16 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and C17 : 0.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Intrasporangiaceae, suborder Micrococcineae of the order Actinomycetales.
The type species is Ornithinibacter aureus.
